flawed_nl_solution:
The additional yard he will be able to run to after improving his speed is 40 x 40/100 = <<40*40/100=61>>61 yards.
So the total yard he will be able to run to after improving his speed is 40 + 61 = <<40+61=101>>101 yards in 5 seconds.
Therefore the total yards he will be able to run to within 10 seconds is 101 x 2 = <<101*2=202>>202.
#### 202

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 61. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
